alert.note: Alert for Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 9:16PM EDT until May 28 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tuckasegee River At Bryson City affecting Swain County. .Significant flows are being released from the reservoirs in the east and west forks of the Tuckasegee River in southern Jackson County. This flow continues to increase due to recent gate openings at Lake Glenville and further rises along the Tuckasegee River are expected over the next several hours. Additional heavy rainfall is possible overnight tonight and may exacerbate ongoing rises. Therefore, the Tuckasegee River at Bryson City is expected to continue rising over the next several hours, and will at least exceed the Minor Flood Stage of 10 feet. However, more significant rises, possibly reaching 12-13 feet, are possible into the early overnight hours. Residents and campers along the Tuckasegee River from Whittier to Bryson City are urged to find higher ground before the river rises to dangerous levels and monitor the latest river levels and forecast for the latest information. Please heed all guidance from Swain County Emergency Management. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tuckasegee River At Bryson City. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Low lying areas between Bryson Walk and the river will flood. Upstream between Main Street and the river, low lying areas including parts of the Bear Hunter Campground will flood. Old River Rd will be experiencing significant flooding. At 11.0 feet, The river will overflow its banks in the park downtown, and low lying areas along Island and Collins Streets will begin to flood. Toot Hollow Branch that flows into the river may overflow its banks and flood areas along the branch especially along Waters Street. Bear Hunter Campground will experience more significant flooding. At 12.0 feet, Businesses near Everett Street and along Island and Carringer Streets may flood. In Whittier, businesses along the river may have water in their loading docks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:46 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 8.2 feet and rising rapidly - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above Minor Flood Stage between 10pm and midnight tonight and will reach at least 10.5 feet early overnight. A crest approaching 12-13 feet is possible overnight, so persons along the river are urged to monitor river levels closely. This is a rapidly evolving situation. Additional heavy rainfall may cause higher crests. The river is not expected to crest until Friday morning and will gradually recede through the rest of the day. - Minor Flood Stage is 10.0 feet. Moderate Flood Stage is 13.5 feet. &&
info.instruction: Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
